Key Arguments: The legislation poses a threat to freedom of speech and represents a dangerous erosion of this fundamental right.
In complex and novel situations, such as the Covid pandemic, it is crucial to have access to all information, even if some of it may be incorrect, to navigate uncertainty and discover the truth.
Restricting speech could prevent necessary scrutiny of powerful entities, such as pharmaceutical companies, and hinder scientific progress.
Government interference in speech could reduce scrutiny of government actions, which is essential for preventing corruption and maintaining democratic institutions.
Historical examples, such as the tobacco industry and thalidomide, demonstrate the importance of open debate and criticism in uncovering truths and protecting public health.
The potential for future misuse of these powers by governments poses a risk to free speech and democracy.
Notable Quotes: I strongly oppose the government interfering with our communication in any way and see it as a dangerous and fundamental erosion of freedom of speech.
We must let these ideas battle freely and trust the truth will out.
Tampering with this process cuts science off at the knees, and risks a skewed understanding of an issue where real humans may be forced to pay the price for ideological convenience.
Allowing governments to dictate narratives to our media companies is an obvious and worrying canary in the coal mine for the health of our free speech.
